author: Grimms
text: The mother of Hans said: "Whither away, Hans?"

author: Grimms
text: What do you bring that is good?"

author: Grimms
text: "I bring nothing, I want to have something given me."

author: Grimms
text: Gretel presents Hans with a needle, Hans says: "Goodbye, Gretel."

author: Grimms
text: Hans takes the needle, sticks it into a hay-cart, and follows the cart home.

author: Grimms
text: You should have stuck the needle in your sleeve."

author: Grimms
text: "Never mind, I"ll do better next time."

author: Grimms
text: What do you bring that is good?"

author: Grimms
text: I want to have something given to me."

author: Grimms
text: Gretel presents Hans with a knife.

author: Grimms
text: Hans takes the knife, sticks it in his sleeve, and goes home.

author: Grimms
text: "Took her nothing, she gave me something."

author: Grimms
text: "That"s ill done, Hans, you should have put the knife in your pocket."

author: Grimms
text: "Never mind, will do better next time."

author: Grimms
text: What good thing do you bring?"

author: Grimms
text: "I bring nothing, I want something given me."

author: Grimms
text: Gretel presents Hans with a young goat.

author: Grimms
text: Hans takes the goat, ties its legs, and puts it in his pocket.

author: Grimms
text: When he gets home it is suffocated.

author: Grimms
text: "That was ill done, Hans, you should have put a rope round the goat"s neck."

author: Grimms
text: "Never mind, will do better next time."

author: Grimms
text: What good thing do you bring?"

author: Grimms
text: "I bring nothing, I want something given me."

author: Grimms
text: Gretel presents Hans with a piece of bacon.

author: Grimms
text: Hans takes the bacon, ties it to a rope, and drags it away behind him.

author: Grimms
text: The dogs come and devour the bacon.

author: Grimms
text: When he gets home, he has the rope in his hand, and there is no longer anything hanging on to it.

author: Grimms
text: "I took her nothing, she gave me something."

author: Grimms
text: "I tied it to a rope, brought it home, dogs took it."

author: Grimms
text: "That was ill done, Hans, you should have carried the bacon on your head."

author: Grimms
text: "Never mind, will do better next time."

author: Grimms
text: "Good day, Hans, What good thing do you bring?"

author: Grimms
text: "I bring nothing, but would have something given."

author: Grimms
text: Gretel presents Hans with a calf.

author: Grimms
text: Hans takes the calf, puts it on his head, and the calf kicks his face.

author: Grimms
text: "I took nothing, but had something given me."

author: Grimms
text: "I set it on my head and it kicked my face."

author: Grimms
text: "That was ill done, Hans, you should have led the calf, and put it in the stall."

author: Grimms
text: "Never mind, will do better next time."

author: Grimms
text: What good thing do you bring?"

author: Grimms
text: "I bring nothing, but would have something given."

author: Grimms
text: Gretel says to Hans: "I will go with you."

author: Grimms
text: Hans takes Gretel, ties her to a rope, leads her to the rack, and binds her fast.

author: Grimms
text: Then Hans goes to his mother.

author: Grimms
text: "She gave me nothing, she came with me."

author: Grimms
text: "I led her by the rope, tied her to the rack, and scattered some grass for her."

author: Grimms
text: "That was ill done, Hans, you should have cast friendly eyes on her."

author: Grimms
text: Hans went into the stable, cut out all the calves" and sheep"s eyes, and threw them in Gretel"s face.

author: Grimms
text: Then Gretel became angry, tore herself loose and ran away, and was no longer the bride of Hans.
